summary: Expense-tracking helper app to manage multiple credit card accounts, import card statements via per-card CSV mappings, map card categories to custom categories, review transactions for copy/paste export, and clear/reset processed data (no long-term storage).
architectural_notes: Data is intended to be temporary: process uploaded statements, allow copy/paste export, and support clearing old data via reset (not long-term storage).
CSV import rules/mappings are per credit-card account and must be configurable in-app.
Per-transaction category overrides are temporary (in-memory/session) and are cleared when the user resets/clears processed data; overrides must propagate immediately to export output.
Add Needs/Wants as an attribute on custom categories; transactions should derive Needs/Wants from the assigned custom category by default, with optional per-transaction override.

existing_features.title: Create a Cards Manager page that lists credit card accounts and allows users to add, edit, and delete cards, including setting a distinct color per card.
Implement statement upload on the Cards Manager page per card with a simple visual cue showing “uploaded” vs “not uploaded” using color styling.
Add a Reset action that clears the current processed/imported transactions and returns cards to a “not uploaded” state (without deleting the cards themselves).
Create a Transactions page that displays imported transactions and shows each transaction’s assigned custom category (custom categories are managed in Settings).
Provide a copy/paste-friendly export view on the Transactions page so the user can copy the cleaned/categorized output for use in a Google Sheet (format can be simple and adjustable later).

Create a Settings page to manage (a) custom categories, (b) mapping from card-provided categories to custom categories (many-to-one), and (c) per-card CSV column mapping configuration (since each card’s CSV format can differ).

Implement CSV import processing such that uploading a statement for a card uses that card’s configured CSV column mapping and produces a temporary in-app transaction set (intended for review/export, not long-term storage).
Add clear navigation between the three primary pages: Cards Manager, Transactions, and Settings.
Apply a cohesive, distinct visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a personal finance helper, avoiding blue/purple as the dominant palette.
Add a per-transaction manual category override control on the Transactions page that lets the user replace the auto-assigned category with a selection from existing custom categories only.
Ensure manual category overrides are temporary UI state (not persisted to the backend) and are cleared when imported transactions are cleared/reset.
Update the export view on the Transactions page so that it immediately uses any manual category overrides when generating the export text.
Update the Settings > Custom Categories UI to allow setting Needs/Wants via a toggle for each custom category, persisting changes to the backend.

Automatically apply Needs/Wants to transactions based on the transaction’s effective custom category (including any per-transaction category override), and display the resulting Need/Want label on the Transactions page.
Add a per-transaction Needs/Wants override control on the Transactions page so a user can override the auto-derived Need/Want label for an individual transaction when needed.

Ensure per-transaction Needs/Wants overrides are temporary UI-only state (not persisted to the backend) and are cleared when transactions are cleared/reset, consistent with existing per-transaction category overrides behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Cards Manager page: add/edit/delete credit card accounts, customize colors, upload statements per card, show uploaded/not-uploaded visual cue, and provide reset button to clear processed data
Transactions page: display imported transactions categorized using user-defined custom categories for review and copy/paste output
Settings page: create/manage custom categories and map card-provided categories to custom categories (many-to-one)
Per-card CSV import configuration: allow each credit card account to have its own configurable CSV column mapping handled via Settings

Transactions page: allow temporary per-transaction manual override of the assigned custom category (select from existing categories only) and have overrides immediately update the export view; cleared on reset

Add Needs/Wants classification: in Settings, each custom category has a Need/Want toggle; transactions inherit the Need/Want label from their assigned custom category automatically, with an option to override per transaction if needed
Extend the backend custom category model to store a Needs/Wants classification per custom category, and expose it via the canister API so the frontend can read and update it.
Add conditional backend migration logic to safely upgrade existing persisted custom categories (currently stored as id -> name) to the new structure that includes Needs/Wants classification.
